reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good - the Hotel is right in the middle of the town, has one of the best eating places, bags and bags of rustic charm in converted historic buildings, the room we were allocated was spaceous with simple fittings, the shower room small, breakfast very busy with a basic choice.
reviews.title: Location,location - a mix of good and not so..

reviews.text: Not so good - no lift, didn't matter to us as we were on the 1st floor, our room 106 was above the kitchen - hot, smelly (chips), very hard beds, thin matresses, noise from the street.
reviews.title: great location and charm

reviews.text: Overall glad to have stayed only the one night.
reviews.title: Unbelievable location - awesome!!
Great meal!
reviews.text: We stayed for one night. It was old and charming. We were right on the main street/plaza, so it was a little noisy. Breakfast was traditional buffet, Romanian style, which is good. We were able to find a parking spot on the main street, but it was a bit of a walk to the hotel with the luggage. It's not completely redone(the bathroom could use a little update), but for the price, location, and charm, I would recommend it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Incredibly friendly staff. Be aware that you may have to park at the bottom and have the hotel car come get your bags - easiest thing to do is walk up the cobblestone path, turn right after the entrance gate, and the hotel is a few steps on the right. 100% satisfaction!
reviews.title: Great !!!

reviews.text: The hotel is very nice, and right in the center of town next to the Citadel. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are good.
reviews.title: Vey nice hotel in the center of town.

reviews.text: There is no elevator so if you don't like stairs I would inquire if they have rooms on the first level.
reviews.title: 3* hotel in the center of town
Liked the Sighisoara
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Sighisoara in May 2005 as part of a package trip through Romania. It's centrally located right in the heart of the old town, just steps away from the main square. It would be a bit of a trek to get here from the train or bus station on foot since it is located at the top of the citadel but if you are driving, you can drive right up to the hotel.

We didn't actually stay at the hotel but we ate almost every meal there. It was so mind boggling how incredible and reasonably priced the food was there when so many of the other eating establishments in the city provided such poor food at the same or even higher prices.
reviews.title: Best food in town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The same goes for the staff. Very friendly, helpful, eager to please, capable in other languages. This place was better than most high end restaurants I have eaten at in the US and Canada. Try them out, you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Amazing location

reviews.text: Nice hotel, nice staff, very helpful. The service will get a 5 stars because they even phoned me to let me know i forgot my charger in the room. i really appreciated that. Dinner served there was beautiful , good service. Same as breakfast. Sleep quality not amazing because we were supposed to be in a double room and that was a twin with beds put together. Anyway... a very good hotel with the most amazing location you can have in Sighisoara , just in the heart of the city.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel with a superb location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wont give 5 stars because the hotel was sad and empty, not animated. I think they had 2-3 rooms booked those 2 nights. But that might be the period when we went, i don`t know... The city itself was not busy at all.
reviews.title: Old hotel which has seen better days...

reviews.text: We got a little lost when trying to find this hotel as it was in the citadel in Sighisoara. However, when we got there it was worth the time that we spent looking for it. It is in a fantastic location, as everything is right on it's door step. There were road works being done right outside the front of the hotel that started very early in the morning (around 6am Romanian time). But this is the only complaint that we had, and it is not something which the hotel can be blamed for.
reviews.title: Great location but no elevator

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely position,at centre of this unesco site,large clean room,no problems,excellent food/bar in courtyard.
reviews.title: rustic charms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I visited the restaurant here during our stay in Sighisoara and found it to be a lovely experience.
reviews.title: Fab restaurant

reviews.text: It is a little pricey compared to other eateries in the area - but compared to England it was very cheap for the two of us to eat! We had a main course, dessert and drink each, plus a side dish to share for around £20 in total! The food was top notch. My husband had a salmon pasta dish which he was very impressed with and I had a vegetarian selection, which was lovely. The deserts were great too.
reviews.title: very good

reviews.text: We sat in the outdoor part of the restaurant, which is covered so even when it's getting late it doesn't cool down too much (in September anyway). It's very pretty, with wooden furniture and plants around the courtyard.
reviews.title: Charming, with great location

reviews.text: The service was great - our waiter was friendly and polite, and was well informed about the dishes when I asked questions about the food containing dairy. He didn't crowd us as some do, or come over to ask if we were okay all the time - which was brilliant as we got to enjoy our meal in peace but he was on hand if we needed anything!
reviews.title: Great Location, OK Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has everything! It is right off the main square in Sighisoara, it is in a fantastic OLD building (I think it used to be the town hall), and the staff is wonderful. This is one of the few places we found in Romania that would do laundry! The hotel oozes with charm and is very reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Spectacular hotel!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is situated in the very heart of the historic centre of this astonishing midieval town. The rooms are very comfortable, we were on the 2nd floor even though I was told that the best rooms are on the 4th floor, but now they were under restoration. There is also a yard and a cellar. To sum up, I couldn't recommend a better hotel to feel the dracula's spirit!!!!!!!
reviews.title: The best dracula's place

reviews.text: I loved this hotel! I can't say enough good things about it. From the beautiful flowers outside my window that was opened each afternoon, to the wonderful breakfast in the morning, to the eager to please staff... this hotel makes you feel like you have gone back in time and gives you a completely relaxing experience. I went as a single person with a group, and can't wait to take my new husband back there. What a wonderful romantic place.
reviews.title: A fairy tale place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Sighisoara on our first visit to Transylvania, and told the manager as we were leaving that we would return. On our second visit a few months later we were delighted to find that the staff remembered us. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble for them, and we ate and drank in the hotel's courtyard restaurant. It must be said that parking in Sighisoara is difficult, but the manager arranged for us to park behind the hotel. The elderly should note that the hotel has no lift, so a room on the first floor should be requested if necessary. in short, good food, great hospitality, great location. Thanks CM!
reviews.title: Good food, great hospitality, great location.

reviews.text: Do not pass on this hotel. Beautiful building, delicious and very affordable restaurant. We rented 2 apartments (4 adults/3 children) and had more than enough room. Beds were very comfortable, bathrooms clean and nice. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful. We ate dinner outdoors at their restaurant and loved every bite. Service was friendly. Hotel Sighisoara is one of the few hotels right in the center of the tourist district. If you didn't stay here then you would have to drive....here you walk out of the lobby and you are there. We booked 1 night and wish we stayed more.
reviews.title: THE BEST LOCATION
